resources:
LockScreen Enter notes Lockscreen for perfect pitch Media volume level NUMBER OF NOTES +1 Start/Stop the service 3 The number must be between 1 and 8 Training OK YES NO Number of notes to play> \u0020on:\u0020 \u0020off:\u0020 \u0020unavailable Settings Basics About About Source code Source code Uninstall Deactivate amin key Deactivate device admin Do you want to deactivate this device admin? Uninstall LockScreen Uninstall LockScreen Build version Boot setting Boot Lock the screen on boot If this setting is enabled, every time the accessibility service gets started (a situation that also occurs when the screen is booted), the number of notes to be played will be set to the value in the box below; also the screen will be locked automatically.\n\nIf this setting is disabled, every time the accessibility service is started, it will only start the main service. Volume Adapter setting Volume Auto adjust volume level Restore the previous volume level If this setting is enabled, if the main service is active and the screen is locked, it will be assigned the optimal value to the media volume based on perceived noise from the microphone.\n\It is also possible to restore the volume level prior to this service modification.\n\nIt increases battery consumption.\n\nIn no case your personal data will be collected. Quick setting Quick setting If this setting is enabled, when LockScreen\'s quick setting is clicked and activated, in addition to starting the main service, the screen gets also locked. Lock the screen when enabled Enabled Disabled Warnings If enabled, the main service undertakes, after the screen wakes up (e.g after the keyguard is gone), to start the lockscreen offered by LockScreen.\n\nIf during this activity any action is taken to bypass it, the screen will be locked again.\n\nThis service can also be managed via quick setting, which, if specified in settings, also provides to lock the screen.\n\nPlease do not start it if you do not have perfect pitch, you may not be able to unlock your screen in emergency situations! If enabled, the main service undertakes, after the screen wakes up (e.g after the keyguard is gone), to start the lockscreen offered by LockScreen.

If during this activity any action is taken to bypass it, the screen will be locked again.

This service can also be managed via quick setting, which, if specified in settings, also provides to lock the screen.

Please do not start it if you do not have perfect pitch, you may not be able to unlock your screen in emergency situations! The following accessibility service undertakes only to LOCK THE SCREEN when:\n1) any action is taken to bypass the lockscreen, if active, offered by LockScreen;\n2) the main service gets started via quick setting;\n3) this service gets started (a situation that also occurs when the screen is booted), if explicitly requested via settings.\n\nIn no case your personal data will be collected. Allow LockScreen to lock the screen In no case your personal data will be collected Number of notes to play Boot switch number of notes to play Boot list number of notes to play Start service First run main First run accessibility setting Volume adapter switch setting Restore previous volume switch setting Quick setting switch enabled Default launcher shared pref C C# D D# E F F# G G# A A# B
